Content.Text:
<FACE_VERONICA><POS_LEFT><FACE_ANGRY>
How many times must I tell you?! I don't have
the time for that!

<FACE_ANGELA><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
And I'M trying to say that the fact you don't have
time is the problem!
<PAGE>
You're always working way too much, Mom.

<FACE_VERONICA><POS_LEFT><FACE_LAUGH>
Oh! Well hello, <MYNAME>. Sorry you caught us
in the middle of something. Please, take a seat.

<FACE_ANGELA><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
Perfect timing! <MYNAME>, I need to talk to you
about something.

<FACE_ANGELA><POS_RIGHT><FACE_LOSS>
My mother won't listen to a word I say, and it's
becoming a problem.

<FACE_VERONICA><POS_LEFT><FACE_NORMAL>
That's enough, Angela. We needn't bother
<MYNAME> with our personal business.

<FACE_ANGELA><POS_RIGHT><FACE_ANGRY>
All right, then let me be blunt. Mom, you need
to get a physical.

<FACE_VERONICA><POS_LEFT><FACE_NORMAL>
I need no such thing, and that is the last I want
to hear of it! Any more and you'll just be wasting
your breath.

<FACE_VERONICA><POS_LEFT><FACE_LAUGH>
I'm sorry, <MYNAME>. Please, have a seat and
relax. I'll go put on some tea.
Sit and relax.
Talk to Angela.

<FACE_VERONICA><POS_LEFT><FACE_NORMAL>
I'm terribly sorry you had to see such a scene.

<FACE_VERONICA><POS_LEFT><FACE_NORMAL>
Angela always tells me I overwork myself, but
look at me. I'm still in good health, am I not?
<PAGE>
Besides, my days are scheduled so tight that I
scarcely have the time to visit the clinic for a
physical.

<FACE_VERONICA><POS_LEFT><FACE_NORMAL>
I understand where my daughter is coming
from, of course, and I'm glad that she cares
about my well-being. But...erm...

<FACE_VERONICA><POS_LEFT><FACE_NORMAL>
To be honest, I'd really rather not let the doctor
examine me. I'm...not sure I agree with some of
his, er...lifestyle choices.

<FACE_VERONICA><POS_LEFT><FACE_SAD>
I know he's not a bad person, but it's...difficult
for me to understand him. I hardly know where
to begin explaining it to my daughter.

<FACE_ANGELA><POS_RIGHT><FACE_SAD>
I'm worried about my mother's well-being.
<PAGE>
She works from morning to night, every day,
even weekends. I'm worried she's working
herself to exhaustion.

<FACE_ANGELA><POS_RIGHT><FACE_SAD>
I understand she has a demanding job, but I
want her to take better care of herself. That's
why I suggested a physical.
<PAGE>
But either she doesn't understand that, or
doesn't want to acknowledge it.

<FACE_ANGELA><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
What...? The doctor is the issue?

<FACE_ANGELA><POS_RIGHT><FACE_LOSS>
Well, I can't say I don't understand why she
might feel that way.

<FACE_ANGELA><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
Well then, how about a compromise? I can be
the one who performs the physical exam.
<PAGE>
I'll handle her physical and give the results to the
doctor to analyze. The doctor will give me his
diagnosis and I'll relate that back to my mother.
<PAGE>
<FACE_LAUGH>This should be a workable solution, and one less
excuse for her to object.

<FACE_ANGELA><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
I hate to ask it of you, but could you propose
that plan to my mother?
<PAGE>
She might still be irritated from our last
argument, so I don't know if she'd hear me out.
You might have better luck.

<FACE_VERONICA><POS_LEFT><FACE_NORMAL>
So, Angela would be giving me the physical
instead of the doctor?

<FACE_VERONICA><POS_LEFT><FACE_NORMAL>
Well, if she's willing to go that far, I suppose I
have no reason to disagree.

<FACE_ANGELA><POS_RIGHT><FACE_LAUGH>
Thank you, <MYNAME>.

<FACE_ANGELA><POS_RIGHT><FACE_LAUGH>
I'll do my best for you, Mom, so please let me
give you a physical.

<FACE_VERONICA><POS_LEFT><FACE_NORMAL>
All right. But please, keep this a secret from the
doctor, would you?

<FACE_ANGELA><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
I'll tell him that you only have time on Sundays,
so this was the easiest way to take care of
things.
<PAGE>
<FACE_LOSS>I'd never want to tell him that it's actually
because he makes you uncomfortable...

<FACE_VERONICA><POS_LEFT><FACE_LAUGH>
Thank you, <MYNAME>. I'm sorry to have
bothered you with this, but in the end, you
helped smooth things over.

<FACE_ANGELA><POS_RIGHT><FACE_LAUGH>
Sheesh. My mother can be so stubborn
sometimes.
<PAGE>
But just between us, she's not the only one
who's uncomfortable around the doctor.
